overview: Brad is a General Partner of i-Hatch Ventures, a $100M fund focused on early stage wireless ventures, whose portfolio includes ZTango (now WiderThan), Vindigo (now Forside), Equator (now PixelWorks), ThumbPlay, LimeLife, M:Metrics (now Comscore), and Reaxion (now Mobliss). Prior to i-Hatch, Brad co-founded Lazard FrÃ¨resâ€™ venture group, funding successful investments including SignalSoft (now OpenWave), Compatible Systems (now Cisco), Sonoma (now Nortel), and Quantum Bridge (now Motorola). Prior to Lazard Brad was an engineer and software entrepreneur, developing products published by Novell, Symantec, pcANYWHERE, and Citrix, and co-developing the first audio input device for personal computers. Brad has an MBA from Harvard Business School, and a degree in Applied Mathematics from Harvard College.
